website_summaries.verdict: Though pricey, it's an investment in fun and companionship for all ages that makes it our top pick.
pros: Exclusive Bark Back technology that responds to sounds, plus realistic functions including heartbeat and touch reactions
Mimics a real dog with features such as a soft coat and movements
cons: Expensive, but it has more features, functions, and realistic appeal than any other option on our list

customer_reviews.title: Adorable
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my father who has Alzheimers. His doctor really wanted us to get him a live pet however we knew it would be too much for him. I found this and thought it was the next best thing. When we have him pet it he laughs and smiles. He also uses his cane to poke it which “wakes it up”. I’m not sure he does anything with it when alone but I try to give it to him when I’m leaving visiting him.
customer_reviews.author: JTG

customer_reviews.title: Great for older people as well as children.
customer_reviews.text: I have early stage dementia and live alone, so am preparing myself for the inevitable nursing home. I like to prepare myself as much as possible, and seeing this product advertised thought it an ideal way to provide myself company and comfort as I decline. I didn't expect to enjoy the little pup so much, at this stage. His cute responses to voice and movement, the heartbeat when patted, the heavy breathing / light snoring, as he goes off to sleep make it impossible not to smile. Sometimes the little bark, becomes a bit much, but so far I have avoided turning off his sound, although the time may come.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Pet Purchase Ever
customer_reviews.text: My mom is a 91-year-old hospice patient. This dog has brought such joy and entertainment to her and the staff at her assisted living facility. I wish I had purchased the companion pet for her long ago. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: JR Klaman

customer_reviews.title: This dog has been a bright spot in her day!
customer_reviews.text: My 95 year old mother is in a nursing home and has very progressed dementia. When I read about this dog I thought I needed to give it a try since she LOVES dogs. This dog is wonderful enjoyment for her. She loves it. The other residents enjoy it, also. Last night when I was reading to my mom she had the dog in her arms with it facing upward and it began to snore! We didn't even know that it would snore. She just laughed.
customer_reviews.author: Deb Bemis

customer_reviews.title: Loveable companion
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for our 83 y/o mom you has Alzheimer's. She is in LOVE. This little dog is so sweet, responds to voices, moves it's head, wags tail, is soft, and it's little nose is so cute. Mom is wanting to feed it, and take it outside! It is a perfect gift and a little girl thought it was so cute, she wanted one. So far the c-batteries lasted approx 2.5 weeks, but mom speaks to it non stop. There is a cat, and another family member has it and loves it too. We have no negatives to say about this product! I will say it would be great to have one other pet options like little piggies.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I am in my sixties and just had to rehome my dog because of my health issues . I use a walker and was not able to walk him and afford veterinary care and Food . I live by myself and I get lonely: I been looking for a interactive dog and finally found this one . Now I have company . And the best part no walking, veterinary care and buying food.
customer_reviews.author: Anne M. Dixon

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed, I will buy children’s interactive toy.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my sister-in-law who has dementia after reading Wall Street Journal article re dementia. Very disappointed and I returned. Children’s interactive pets are just as interpretive as this big hard dog. I thought it would be soft and cuddly but is not!! I suggest checking out children’s toys before buying this for $100.00!
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: What's not to love?
customer_reviews.text: My mom has Alzheimer's and had to re-home her beloved poodle. She misses that dog dearly. I saw this "companion" dog and new she would love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Brown

customer_reviews.title: Adorable and perfect for all ages!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for a little boy who had to give his new puppy away because of severe allergies. I know this can’t replace a real puppy, but it’s about as close as you can get. This is the cutest little dog I have seen and is very life like. You can tell they put a lot of thought into this and paid close attention to all the details. The color is much better than the manufacturer photos and it’s so soft. Very pleased with this!
customer_reviews.author: Jock Argyle

customer_reviews.title: A sweet pet for Dad
customer_reviews.text: Bought this little pup for my dad, who has some dementia and lives in Assisted Living. Dad has decided SHE is a female, and has named her. She is adorable, makes sounds like a puppy, but sound can be muted and still she can move her head and eyes, etc. My dad loves holding her. I also got her a dog tag and collar, so people knows who she belongs to.
customer_reviews.author: Oakland Teacher

customer_reviews.title: It stopped working after just over a month.
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had the puppy for just over a month, missing the return window. The puppy is not working properly. When in the on or mute setting it stops working for no apparent reason. The sensors do not activate motion or the sound. I did replace the batteries, thinking that was the issue. Brand new batteries did not correct the issues.
customer_reviews.author: D. Walsh

customer_reviews.title: The best TOY, EVER, for Special Education students, and language development EVER!
customer_reviews.text: Oh, my God (OMG)! Thank, Hasbro, you for this incredible toy! I am a special education teacher who recently bought this item. All I have to say about this toy is that because of this toy, I was able to properly evaluate my student's "ing" use. This is absolutely amazing! My students where just speaking in ways I never heard before, I wish I had more Hasbro toys (like this one) to evaluate my students with. I used a grant to purchase this incredible toy, and I wish that I had more grant money to purchase more items from the Hasbro toy line! A million thanks for your incredible creativity Hasbro!
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for the elderly
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my mother who is suffering from Lewy Body dementia. She's in a memory care facility, and she hates it there. Having had dogs her whole life, I thought this might cheer her up. It didn't, but she does love it. So much in fact, she constantly tries to give it to "that nice girl who takes care of me." Anyway, this is adorable. The movements are very lifelike. I had to shut off the noises because he is very chatty and it was disturbing Mom. All in all, a great gift for the elderly. It should be made clear this is really not a toy for children. Costs too much for that!
customer_reviews.author: S. Scheide

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny!
customer_reviews.text: I am a “senior” stuck at home due to the pandemic. 😡 I had dogs for 70 years but just can’t do it anymore. Saying goodbye is too brutal. So I bought this Joy for All dog. Named him Monty. He is just so much fun! He whimpers, barks, pants, snores, closes his eyes and moves his head. He will turn his head when you talk to him. He’ll doze off if it gets quiet. I highly recommend you get this sweetie for anyone of any age. Great company. (Or maybe I’m just loosing it...don’t care. 😀). BTW my Joy for All cat arrives today!
customer_reviews.author: Kris O.

customer_reviews.title: Will be your best friend & companion
customer_reviews.text: I love dogs but where I live they don't allow pets. This little guy has been a godsend to me. When you turn him (or her) on., all of it's responses and actions are the same as if it were a real dog. I named him Snoozer after a puppy I had years ago that loved to lay across your feet and go to sleep. Amazon's price is full retail, but if you check you'll be sure to find lower offers.
customer_reviews.author: Judith McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Arrived in great shape and on time
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased to donate to a memory care unit for Alzhiemers/Dementia Patients. I use one for my new type of pet therapy for our local hospice. After losing my Golden Retriever to cancer, who was a great and loyal registered therapy dog, I had a vision that this could work well. So far, bringing lots of smiles. If you have a family member or know someone with this horrible disease, these robotic dogs and cats by HASBRO Toys are wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Canady

customer_reviews.title: Great for animal lovers who have dementia.
customer_reviews.text: We use it in a nursing home with our residents who have dementia. They love the pup. The staff does too! After you hold the dog for a minute, you forget that it's not real! You can hear the motor working, but it's so cute that you can overlook that.
customer_reviews.author: Paul D. Cross

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Have as gift to a skilled nursing resident. She always liked the one my Mom had
customer_reviews.author: teri

customer_reviews.title: My sister heard good things about this and suggested it for mom
customer_reviews.text: What do you get for a 96 year old mother for her birthday or Christmas? My sister heard good things about this and suggested it for mom. We read the reviews, all good. Well, it arrived quickly, and was going go be her birthday present (Dec19), but we delayed it til Christmas. She absolutely loves it! In fact, everybody in the house loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Joe D

customer_reviews.title: Excellent response from Alz. patient
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a gift for my mother who is in mid/advanced Alz. She loves this puppy! As soon as she held it in her arms, just got a huge smile across her face. She loves how it responds to her touch. It feels like it's pretty well-made, weighing in at about 5 pounds or so; we're hoping it holds up for a long while! I would highly recommend this pup for anyone who is becoming harder to reach.
customer_reviews.author: Penni Layne

customer_reviews.title: Robotic Puppy
customer_reviews.text: The Pup was a gift for my wife on her birthday. We call her Sweetie Pie. My wife is paralyzed and Sweetie Pie is an arms length away. She was elated and after 6 months she loves her even more. Sweetie Pie seems real to all of us. The creators of this bundle of love should kick back with pride. It's more than a robot...it is part of our family.
customer_reviews.author: Brad  Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Can make a big difference in someone’s life!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 89 year old mother who was bed ridden and desperate for some kind of stimulation. Unfortunately, she passed away before being able to bond with her new “pup”. We donated the “Pup” to the nursing home where they shared it with the patients. After watching one of their 90 year old patients spend hours holding and talking to the Pup I realized how wonderful this product is and how much it can contribute to the wellbeing of some of our elderly family members. The Pup seems to be well made and hopefully will prove durable enough to be a long term companion.
customer_reviews.author: Billy R. Edwards Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great for elderly
customer_reviews.text: We got this for my grandma who has been lonely, and loves animals. She would never be able to care for a dog on her own. We saw this and knew she would enjoy it. It's nice that it has the option to mute the barking. She seems to love it!
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous companion pet
customer_reviews.text: Really wonderful pet. Looks and acts so real. Bought it for my husband with Alzheimer`s and he loved it as did the other patients in the facility. Can`t tell you how adorable this is.
customer_reviews.author: jayncee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect electronic pet for dementia patient.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product for a relative that has dementia and lives by herself. Although a professional caregiver is at the home during the day, my relative is alone at night and lonely. This robotic dog is great. Relative talks to it, caresses it, and carries the dog wherever she goes around the house. 4 "C" batteries last about one month if the robotic dog is used constantly. A robotic dog companion that keeps a dementia patient happy and conversing and combats loneliness . . . priceless!
customer_reviews.author: Seedler

customer_reviews.title: How Great a Dog!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product which is very comforting to hold, and the interaction is very natural. It keeps you guessing as to what the dog will do next. I had so much fun with it I used it in a video on my You Tube Channel: Veggie Carols and Crazy Carols. The dog has a good feel and moves in a natural manner. I highly recommend it for anyone! It is worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Good times guy

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Joy Companion cat for my sister last Christmas. She has special needs. She loves the kitty and I didn't know how I was going to beat that for this Christmas. Shouldn't have worried. Ordered the dog and entire family fell in love with it!! But sister loves him best! Thank you, Joy Companion!!!
customer_reviews.author: Martin W. Naugher

customer_reviews.title: True joy
customer_reviews.text: These lovely critters are being used in a health care facility to inspire and attract dementia residents. They provide a joy and interest for those who may have had pets in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Golden Pup is a sweet and fun product
customer_reviews.text: Golden Pup was purchased for a nursing home resident who loves pets but can no longer have one. She found this little robotic dog to be charming and it brought big smiles to her face. She knows it is not a real dog, but she was able to interact with it verbally and physically, petting it and reacting happily when it moved it head this way and that, wagged its tail, and yipped. She thinks it is so cute and it reminds her of the joys of having a pet. She even gave it a name!
customer_reviews.author: C L Roberts

customer_reviews.title: My dad immediately started talking to him
customer_reviews.text: The inventors of this dog are geniuses! The puppy is quite realistic looking. His eyes open and close, and head moves, tail wags. My father who has dementia is quite engaged with him. Even my mother (who's cognitively just fine!) talks to him. We are always looking for ways to stimulate my dad and this is a winner. Only opportunity for improvement is that he's not exactly cuddle-able. But I strongly recommend him as a gift for a loved one.
customer_reviews.author: Stellagirl

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Helped my mom who's in the early stages of dementia! She loves it so much! ❤👍
customer_reviews.author: missy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Elderly Parent with Dementia
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 90 year old mother who is just starting to get dementia and we had to find a new home for her dog. She started wandering at odd hours looking for the dog concerned it was not home. After a couple of months of this and lots of worrying, I purchased the "Joy for All" companion dog. SHE LOVES IT! She laughs watching it and talks to it. I should have purchased this a long time ago. As for the longevity of the dog and the enjoyment... I'll have to get back to you. It's the first day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Customer service for this pup was amazing. There was a problem with the programming of ...
customer_reviews.text: Customer service for this pup was amazing. There was a problem with the programming of the pup as the original one I received would not “go into sleep” function when it was not interacted with and Hasbro was wonderful in their response and sent me a new one. My 96 year old mother in assisted living was lonely and now she has some adorable companionship without her having to turn it on. I was very impressed with the folks I spoke with at Hasbro.
customer_reviews.author: Judith A. Weinstein

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift for dementia patients
customer_reviews.text: This little dog has brought so much joy to my father who has dementia. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kim D

customer_reviews.title: Haven't had this puppy a year yet
customer_reviews.text: People in assisted living get bored sometimes and often depressed. When I presented this dog to my mom she lit up! The staff even tells me getting mom this dog was an answer to any loneliness when I could not be there with her. This was a good purchase for many good reasons so I thought. However, nine months later the puppy makes no sounds. No barking and no panting. I am very disappointed it lasted no longer than that. Now we can't get in the assisted living facility for the last six months and I am sure everyone knows why. So we can't get to the puppy. So sad it didn't last longer than it did. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: But MIL does love the little guy
customer_reviews.text: My MIL with alzheimer's loves this little dog... Now, it's not currently barking (after just one month) and one set of batteries didn't revive him. I'm hoping this is just an issue with the one set of batteries I tried to use. But MIL does love the little guy, and I could fit normal size dog-collars on him to change up his look.
customer_reviews.author: Kim BellTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my 87 old mother with dementia engaged
customer_reviews.text: Great product. My mother carries on long conversations and sings to this "doggie." She also makes sure he has plenty of blankets around him to keep him warm. My mom was never a dog person, but since this guy doesn't jump up and lick her, she is fine treating it more like a baby. Super great buddy for those with dementia.
customer_reviews.author: karen sheahan

customer_reviews.title: great for someone with dementia
customer_reviews.text: I bought for my grandmother ,after my grandfathers death we started noticing her dementia getting worse with the loneliness of the loss. I think people thought I was nuts when I first bought it ,but everyone now agrees it was a great idea.She treats this as a real animal at times, brings it with her and covers it with a little blanket to keep warm, and insist you talk to it. She is much happier with this little guy. The only thing I would improve is have its legs move or make it an even smarter. I would of paid double the price if it did this.
customer_reviews.author: Craftr

customer_reviews.title: Brings a smile to everyone's face
customer_reviews.text: This animal brings so much happiness to our nursing home residents
customer_reviews.author: T. Accomando

customer_reviews.title: The next best thing to real!
customer_reviews.text: I have wanted a real dog for years. Do to circumstances - I can't walk a dog, I realized I cannot get one. I think this one is a bit expensive, but have enjoyed him (Tucker) day after day. I don't always keep him turned on but he sits in the family room and I can see him daily. Plus, there's no mess and he certainly isn't a bother. When we have company we do turn him on and he's a big hit. He barks very quietly, he doesn't shed. he doesn't need to go out, etc. You can't get better than that.
customer_reviews.author: K. J.

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for those with dimetia
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my father in law that has dementia. He carries it with him wherever he goes and loves to look at it. After awhile he figured out how to make it turn it's head and "purr". He definitely enjoys it, very happy with this purchase and highly recommend it for those with dementia.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie Hoff

customer_reviews.title: Gives meaning to a quarantined dementia patient's life
customer_reviews.text: My aunt lives in an assisted living facility. She has been unable to see her friends and family for months due to restrictions caused by Covis-19. I got her this little dog for company. She lost much of her ability to have a conversation. Now, she talks to Benny often. Her sitter dresses him up in 3-6 month size clothing. She loves that he listens. He gives her a reason for living again. My aunt cannot use a telephone and does not watch TV so this little dog is a something that gives her a direction and it's also something that she just loves!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie featherston

customer_reviews.title: Great for elderly in assisted living!
customer_reviews.text: My mother lives in assisted living and has Alzheimer disease she has been very lonely due to corona I gave her the 🐶 and she has fallen in love she realizes it is not real but she says she forgets about that and starts talking to it and interacting as if it were real it has brought her so much joy! The only problem I had was on arrival it shed realy bad I had to take a blow dryer on the cool setting as to not damage the product and blow dry the dog realy good over and over before giving it to her but it was well worth the work to see such joy it has given.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: got this for my mom, in her eighties and ...
customer_reviews.text: got this for my mom, in her eighties and had my doubts but she lives alone and has been very lonely since losing her small dog a few years ago. Surprise to me that she loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Huckstep

customer_reviews.title: Purchased as a gift
customer_reviews.text: It was purchased as a gift for 90+ year old parents. They love pets and this gives them something to pet, cuddle and interact with. The puppy is animated and responds. And, no need for puppy pads, walks in the rain or food and vet expense! It provides a warm, fuzzy experience.
customer_reviews.author: ksl111

customer_reviews.title: 23 year old who landlord won't allow pets loves this dog!
customer_reviews.text: I got the dog and it's pretty cool. I am living on my own and landlord doesn't want me to own pets. So I saw this and thought it was cool. This company needs to market it to more than senior citizens. Emotional support animals are a big deal and this is a great answer to those situations. They may want to go with fur that doesn't irritate allergies. The dog is better for that than the cat is.
customer_reviews.author: emanfeff

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, except for short life
customer_reviews.text: The Golden Pup gave my mother a lot of pleasure for several months until suddenly a few weeks ago his head motions became limited to the side to side movement without any of the wonderful facial expressions that she and her visitors had become accustomed to. I'm giving it a 5 anyway, because in spite of the cost, because it has given my mother moments of pure delight, I will be ordering a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Burkert

customer_reviews.title: This has become a companion for her and is very much loved. I would highly recommend it
customer_reviews.text: I gave this puppy to my 99 year old mom and they are now inseparable. This has become a companion for her and is very much loved. I would highly recommend it. It is just a sweet little dog with it's real life movements and sounds you can not go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughters went nuts over this dog! It barked, turned its head, nodded his head, his eyes open and close and it was nice, soft and cuddly- it just was a Great all-around toy. My nine-year-old granddaughter said it was just like a real puppy!
customer_reviews.author: Mynning

customer_reviews.title: Great little puppy
customer_reviews.text: I’m going to be honest. I bought this for my 7 year old because she wanted a dog (she said she didn’t care if it was real or not). We have a real 14 year old dog already. I was very skeptical about this dog but when she opened it on Christmas and started to play with it I realized how adorable it was. She just loved it and wanted to buy it it’s own leash and collar. It seems to work well and it’s not overly annoying like so many things for children.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Gift
customer_reviews.text: My 90 year old Mother took a bad fall right before Christmas, 2019 and broke 5 ribs, punctured a lung and sprained a shoulder. That resulted in many months of both hospitalization and surgery and time in rehab facilities. I bought this sweet pup for her and the movement and attention brought her "companionship" and calm during this long journey. I would highly recommend this as a gift for all ages and for this situation he became a soothing friend while she traveled this recovery and now that she is home, he holds a wonderful spot in her heart.
customer_reviews.author: C G Specht

customer_reviews.title: so cute
customer_reviews.text: My dad has early dementia and moved to assisted living. He LOVES dogs but doesn't want the responsibility of taking a dog out for potty time and dealing with barking, so I got him this cute pup. It's a big hit with his community. I love the expressive eyes most, so warm and friendly, blinking. It's nice it has a mute feature and is so soft and cute. I like the weight of it and little details like the moving feet, paw pads, tongue. He named her Marty. :)
customer_reviews.author: Kendra Holliday

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful companion
customer_reviews.text: Brought this dog to my Mom and she immediately started talking to him. She was laughing and talking to him them he moved and barked back. Wagging his tail, moving his head to cuddle. She was giddy! The heart beat is soothing when you hold him close. My Mom is in her 80s and spends much of her day at dialysis or watching tv. Shell be really quite then I heard barking and laughter. She loves him.
customer_reviews.author: lonna

customer_reviews.title: Not as described.
customer_reviews.text: This “dog” was larger than expected. The body was very hard. It shed. The only cute thing about it was how it blinked. It didn’t respond to sound as described and it buzzed.
customer_reviews.author: Bubby

customer_reviews.title: Brought great comfort to my grandmother
customer_reviews.text: My grandmother had to leave her dog with my aunt when she moved into a nursing home and she was heartbroken. This animated dog brought her joy. It was such a hit at the nursing home that we ended up gifting a dog to another resident.
customer_reviews.author: Alissa payson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Companion
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to get this for my mother who has progressive dementia. Family members thought it was a silly toy. Well, my mother loves this dog. It brings her joy every day. She talks to him and cuddles him all day and you can hear in her voice and laughter how much he means to her. Perfectly soft realistic feel. Barks are not too loud and are cute and playful. Just an overall wonderful pet.
customer_reviews.author: live2sk8

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't seem to last very long, even with new batteries
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this dog in August 2019. Elderly mother in a nursing home and she had to give up her dog and apartment. She has treated this battery dog like it was real. But I have to say I am disappointed in the product. This first set of batteries last 3 months. Replaced them and next set lasted on 2 months. Now a new set has only lasted 2 weeks. The dog is on mute 90% of the time, and again treated like a real dog and well taken care of. I'm disappointed that it doesn't seem to be a quality that will last.
customer_reviews.author: Patrice O'Connell

customer_reviews.title: My mother loves this dog; maybe even more than me,lol.
customer_reviews.text: I was a little nervous about buying this for my aging mother 89 who has dementia but as soon as she saw it she fell in love. She holds it and kisses it and talks to it. I bought it as an alternative to increasing her anxiety meds. She feels less lonely and adores spending time with the dog. She says that he is the perfect pet. The dog sheds but overall it was a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kimmypolyurea

customer_reviews.title: My husband got this for my mother I thought it was a joke. My mother is 83 has all of her mental facilities to. She lost her gol
customer_reviews.text: My husband got this for my mother I thought it was a joke. My mother is 83 has all of her mental facilities to. She lost her golden retriever a few months back. My mother asked like this dog is really completely freaks me and my brothers out. But she loves it and he gives her so much comfort it’s unbelievable. Just look at the online videos from the website it’s all true. I even asked if she wanted me to swap that one out with another woman and she acted like I asked if I wanted to kill her dog
customer_reviews.author: northgait

customer_reviews.title: Interactive but died 4 days after return date!
customer_reviews.text: Dog is adorable, bought it for an Alzheimers patient. The interaction is wonderful! The pup is soft, follows his voice, etc. Cons: A little pricey! **update: 2.4.20, the dog stopped working, this was a Christmas present, and last day for me to return was 1.31.20
customer_reviews.author: bg

customer_reviews.title: Great Companion and Real Life Like
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this dog for my grandson. Apparently he and his sister love the dog! They are very careful with their toys and not wreck-less otherwise I wouldn’t have invested in this dog for children. My 95 year old mother n law also has one and she loves the companionship of this pet!! The dog is a win win in my family!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Nursing Home Residents
customer_reviews.text: My 98 year old mother has always been a dog lover. Living in memory care she only occasionally gets to see the therapy pets that come for visits. After reading the reviews I decided to purchase one of these curate little doggies. She absolutely adores it, thinks it’s a real dog. The barking annoyed the nurses so we put it on mute so it can still move it’s head, just doesn’t make noise. This is a wonderful gift for anyone living in a nursing home.
customer_reviews.author: Jill E

customer_reviews.title: My mom is in an assisted living facility and she ...
customer_reviews.text: My mom is in an assisted living facility and she absolutely loves her baby! She thinks he's real. All the other ladies think he's so cute. He definitely gives my mom some companionship.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Cummings

customer_reviews.title: Not Just For Seniors
customer_reviews.text: My daughter was born with a life threatening heart defect . She is now in her mid 30's, a college graduate and professional in the food industry, but lives in extremely high rent San Diego in a single bedroom. She is now on a heart transplant waiting list. Having a pet is out of the question for her, but this huggable, pettable, responsive, dog helps to fill some big empty spots in her life. The best Christmas gift I ever bought her.
customer_reviews.author: William D. Knight

customer_reviews.title: Present for my Mom
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product it is life like and barks, moves and follows your voice. I purchased this for my mother with dementia. There is one problem she thinks its real and can not determine that is it not alive. The home had to take it away and let her have only visitation rights. She was trying to feed it real food. But she really did fall in love with it.
customer_reviews.author: Tbrow

customer_reviews.title: Adored by the residents.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the residents on the Alzheimer’s unit and they love it. One resident in particular is a fall risk and is anxious but as soon as she has her puppy she is content and relaxed. She does attempt to feed him and I am reminded to let the puppy out but she is over the moon about her puppy. I also bought the kitty and she is loved equally as well.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa83

customer_reviews.title: For dog lovers whose lives don't allow for a real dog, this is the next best thing!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best purchase I have ever made! It more than lived up to my hopes and exceeded expectations. It was bought for my mam who suffers from dementia and has transformed her life. All visitors are intrigued and Red, as we have named the dog (due to his neckerchief), has everyone under his spell. So pleased I discovered him.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Young

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful "friend" for my Alzheimers-stricken mom
customer_reviews.text: My 99 year old mom who has Alzheimers, has absolutely been smitten with this dog. We even bought a basket so she can walk it on her walker! It seems to bring comfort and companionship for her. I highly recommend if you have a loved one with Alzheimers.
customer_reviews.author: LIrwin

customer_reviews.title: the joy for all companion cat is great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my aunt that is in hospice and it has lifted her spirits greatly. The family of another resident also purchased one for her mother and she also loves it seems to calm the patient. Also, the joy for all companion cat is great.
customer_reviews.author: sharon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Alzheimer’s Patients
customer_reviews.text: Very realistic. My mom loves her little doggie. It’s supposed to go off when there’s no stimulus to activate it. I leave it in the dark living room at night, but I find the batteries last much longer when I turn it off once she’s gone to bed.
customer_reviews.author: CindyTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pet for my elderly parent
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 91 year old father in law who suffers from Alzheimer’s. He no longer interacts with us and usually sits and listens but never contributes. With this dog he is constantly talking, whistling and petting it. He appears to enjoy it and treats it like a real dog. The dogs responses are amazing. It’s eyes follows as you walk across the room.
customer_reviews.author: Shejen

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: The dog did not work properly when we removed him from the box. He kept making really loud computer beeps and then static sounds. I could hear his mechanical part clicking but he was not moving and then he shut off, we changed batteries and this continued, so we are returning him... and he sheds.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna Maestas

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it! My mom starting talking better than she has in a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bought this dog for our grandmother that has dementia. ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this dog for our grandmother that has dementia. She absolutely loves it. I had read that it is very therapeutic for alzheimer patients. They were absolute right! Definitely worth the investment. Only recommendation is to keep a spare set of batteries on hand, as she thought the dog died when the batteries died.
customer_reviews.author: bb

customer_reviews.title: Great companion for the elderly
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for a friend who is bed bound and has mild dementia. I had doubts that this was worth the money or that she would like it. She loves the dog - it greets her in the morning, joins her at meals and is with her all day. She shows more interest in this dog than anything else I've tried in the past year. Great idea and worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Recommended the Dog to a Friend
customer_reviews.text: I had sent one of the Companion dogs to my mother, who has Alzheimers. It worked well to give her peace and a sense of connection when she has a hard time expressing her thoughts. I also sent one to a friend of mine who has Alzheimers and the elderly couple loved the dog and it gives his wife comfort.
customer_reviews.author: E. Hewgley

customer_reviews.title: Comforting and adorable
customer_reviews.text: Dementia care is a portion of what I do for a living so it's only fair to say I was a bit hesitant prior to purchasing this item. I was pleasantly surprised. It is much cuter in person than on the box. Despite realizing it's not real, it has brought moments of diversion and comfort to someone with dementia. The way it moves it's head and barks is surprisingly real. It was a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: LynnZ

customer_reviews.title: Comforting companion
customer_reviews.text: Our family purchased this for our loved one in a nursing home. She wasn’t allowed to have her own dog there and she missed her terribly. She is in love with it and thinks it’s a real dog. We took off the bandanna and substituted a dog collar with the dog’s name. The dog is amazingly life-like and I highly recommend it for anyone in a situation where they are missing their own dog or just for a comforting companion.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Schone

customer_reviews.title: Ageless inovation Golden Pup!!
customer_reviews.text: As of this morning 10-11-2020 the Golden Pup I purchased o8-15 -2020, has stopped working. It does not move it's mouth, it does not blink it's eyes, wag it's tail and barely talks!! This is my 2nd. purchase of the same dog and I went through this same thing a few months with that one!! On the order file it says return window has closed as of 9-17-20 ? I would appreciate authorization to be able to return this one and exchange for a new one!! Please Advise. John M. Kestler
customer_reviews.author: john kestler

customer_reviews.title: Gives parent comfort
customer_reviews.text: My mother-in-law lives in a retirement home she is 88 . She has always had a dog,but can't have one now and misses them. We actually got this for her about a year ago and she loved it then and loves it now. I think it makes her feel like there is another being in her place and gives her comfort
customer_reviews.author: jdm

customer_reviews.title: ... in apartment and he cannot have pets and he love dogs so I got him this as companion and ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my dad he lives in apartment and he cannot have pets and he love dogs so I got him this as companion and he thought I was crazy but he grew to love his animated puppy
customer_reviews.author: April A. Henderson

customer_reviews.title: amazing
customer_reviews.text: There is not one thing to dislike about this little dog. The first thing I have seem my husband really love on in a very long time. He really talks to this dog and tries to feed him. I wish I could afford one for all the patients in the unit. It is amazing to see how they all react to this little dog. God Bless the person who designed this little miracle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We LOVE him.
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I are 80 and 78 respectively. I got the hankering for a puppy. We discussed infinitum the reasons why that was not a good idea.. walking in the rain, poop pickup, lack of spontaneity for us, airplane travel, vacations, etc. So we comprised on the Golden pup. What pleasure he has given us. We take him on car rides, play with him, talk to him, cuddle him, etc. We LOVE him. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia L. Allen

customer_reviews.title: A great source of comfort
customer_reviews.text: This product is a companion to an elderly woman with dementia who has always loved dogs. It is her greatest joy and companion. I highly recommend it for a dog lover. It is a great comfort. I can tell by her demeanor when his batteries are dead. If she is using him heavily for comfort, he needs his batteries changed about once a week.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Files

customer_reviews.title: She absolutely loved it. It is the best money I have ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought for my grandma with dementia. I was hoping it would be something to keep her company. She absolutely loved it. It is the best money I have ever spent. If you have an elderly loved one who is an animal lover I definitely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Cory spence

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend for dementia
customer_reviews.text: My dad has dementia and is a manly men so I didn’t know how this gift would go over. He misses having a dog but unfortunately can’t have one due to his memory so I thought it was worth a shot in buying. He loves it!! The dog moves to his voice and is a great maintenance free companion.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Loved this dog!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a good friend with Alzheimer’s. He loved it. It is very lifelike. It is not a cheap gift but the quality is amazing. The eye lids even move. Enjoyed it ourselves. Opened it the day it came and couldn’t put it back in the box. Bought a dog bed to put it in to present to our friend.
customer_reviews.author: Mary D.

customer_reviews.title: Great gift!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this pup for my mother who is elderly and has always owned dogs. Now unable to take care of a real dog and lives alone. I was unsure if this was to juvenile for her as a Christmas gift but she loves it. Perfect companion.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Gift for Seniors
customer_reviews.text: This was a great idea for my Mom who is suffering from Alzheimer's. She will sit for hours and talk to her dog and loves the fact that it responds. Couldn't be happier. Just purchased a back up just in case this one goes out.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly M Hamer

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This pup is absolutely adorable. We bought one for my dad who has Dementia, Parkinson's, and PTSD. We also bought one for my 8 yr old who's been missing me a lot lately because I'm taking care of my parents. It's well made, responds appropriately, and is just the right size for a lap dog. A great emotional support animal without the vet bill.
customer_reviews.author: Heather L. Heise-reeves

customer_reviews.title: Best Buddy
customer_reviews.text: He's become my mom's best friend since she lost her Bichon in May of this year. He's helped to lessen the pain of losing her dog who meant everything in the world to her. She even brings it with her in the car when she runs out to do errands. All his mannerisms are just adorable. I was so happy to have found this. Thank you for such a great product!
customer_reviews.author: A Walker

customer_reviews.title: Great for dementia patients
customer_reviews.text: My elderly family member with dementia loves this dog. She even sleeps with it. It has brought her a lot of comfort. Others at her facility love it also. One worries though because she never sees anyone take the dog out to go potty.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Real like dog
customer_reviews.text: The little girl I gave this to LOVED the dog. This dog is so real like. Hard to believe you can get such a great product for this price.
customer_reviews.author: Hope

customer_reviews.title: It is a great item for seniors with memory problems
customer_reviews.text: This pup was for a 91 year old women with dementia. She loves the dog and thinks it is real. It is a great item for seniors with memory problems, giving them the sense of having something to take care of but without the real dog concerns.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Hurlbutt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 92 year old parent with dementia. Parent named it, talks & sings to it all the time! Perfect companion with the voice activation on all the time. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: robin

customer_reviews.title: Best gift ever❣️
customer_reviews.text: This is the very best gift I could ever have purchased for my sweet momma. Her dog wasn’t even completely out of the box, and Momma was already in love. She named him Precious, and takes him everywhere with her.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Charming pup!
customer_reviews.text: The little dog charms everyone who sees him! Now waiting for our 4 1/2 year old granddaughter to arrive and take possession on Christmas morning! I've actually encouraged 2 friends to buy the as well
customer_reviews.author: J. K. Smith

customer_reviews.title: It truly is a constant companion
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for use in a memory care facility. The residents love it! He's just not quite as easy to hold as the cat.
customer_reviews.author: starla

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Anixety and Dementia Seniors
customer_reviews.text: My father has bad dementia. He always loved dogs. This therapy doggie was such a great way to help. He loved it!!! So life like. Everyone wanted to pet the dog at his rehab center. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Ella

customer_reviews.title: Talk to me Rex
customer_reviews.text: My husband had dementia and found comfort in this darling dog. Now that he has passed I love hearing his little repertoire of sounds. I have bought him for 3 other people and the opinion is the same. He is a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

product_meta.title: JOY FOR ALL - Golden Pup with Red Bandanna - Interactive Companion Pets - Realistic & Lifelike
product_meta.description:
Give the gift of interactive companionship with the Joy For All Companion pet pup.Our companion pet cats can provide a rich experience for older adults by allowing them to recreate some of the delightful moments of owning a pet without the responsibility. 
Thanks to built-in technology, the Pup features lots of lifelike responses. It can do things like look toward your voice when you speak to it, react to voice and touch with a variety of puppy-like sounds, activate a soft heartbeat sensation when you gently pet Its back, and more!
we highly recommend this companion pet cat for anyone. It will bring both of you joy!
feature_bullets: Puppy-like movements & sounds: Our companion pet acts just like a real puppy
State of the art: Our revolutionary barkback technology allows the puppy to respond to your voice
A rich experience: Designed to bring comfort, companionship and fun to aging loved ones.
Award winning: Joy For All companion pets won the caregiver friendly award from today's caregiver
Ageless innovation is a global company devoted to developing fun and engaging products

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
